byline.contributor: Ana Vanessa Herrero reported from Caracas, and Nicholas Casey from New York. Patricia Torres contributed reporting from Caracas.
byline.original: By ANA VANESSA HERRERO and NICHOLAS CASEY

abstract: Venezuelan Pres Nicolas Maduro's announcement that all 100-bolivar notes, country's highest-denomination, will be removed from circulation almost immediately sparks panic as residents line up at banks to exchange them; Maduro says sudden move is intended to keep organized crime groups from hoarding currency.
lead_paragraph: Long lines and confusion at banks after an announcement that all 100-bolívar notes must be exchanged.
snippet: Long lines and confusion at banks after an announcement that all 100-bolívar notes must be exchanged....

headline.main: Venezuela Voids Popular Form of Currency, Setting Off Panic
headline.print_headline: Venezuela Voids Popular Form of Currency, Setting Off Panic
